Header: Notices issued against Gamini Senarath and three others
Content: Notices were issued to former Presidential Chief of Staff, Gamini Senarath and three others to appear before the Special high court on the 24 th of this month. The case has been filed at the special high court on financial scam connected with the Litro Lanka Gas Company. It is accused that 500 million rupees were invested in the Helanko Hotel private Limited that has been transferred to Canvin Holdings Company from Litro Lanka. The special high court was set up to investigate mega scale financial frauds and corruptions. The very first case to be taken up at the newly established high court is the litigation against Gamini Senarath and three others. Former Managing Director of the Insurance Corporation Piyadasa Kudabalage, former Samurdhi Commissioner Neel Bandara Hapuhinna and Lasantha Bandara are the other suspects of the alleged corrupt case. The case is taken up before a three member bench. Meanwhile, the writ filed at the court of appeal requesting to declare members elected under the ticket of motor bike to the Maharagama Municipal Council disqualified was withdrawn today. The petitioner says as some defendants have already resigned it is difficult to continue the case. He also said that he plans to file a new case instead.
